title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Red Sox have $218.92 million committed for 2026, nearly reaching the luxury tax threshold.
Outfielder Kyle Tucker and pitcher Dylan Cease are among free agents linked to the Red Sox.
Players like Trevor Story and Lucas Giolito have options for 2026; Story has a potential extra year option.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game this regular season as part of CBS's broadcast team.
The Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye, have achieved a surprising 6-2 record this season.
McCourty expressed surprise at the team's rapid improvement and praised Maye's quarterback performance.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are reportedly interested in trading for Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips.
Phillips, 26, ranks 11th in pressures among edge rushers and may require a third-round pick for a trade.
The Dolphins' recent performance and leadership changes increase trade speculation ahead of the deadline.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Mason Lohrei was left out of the lineup for the third consecutive game against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm believes Lohrei should be frustrated, encouraging him to use the time to learn and improve.
The return of Hampus Lindholm and improved play from Nikita Zadorov has influenced defensive lineup decisions.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Falcons quarterback Michael Penix struggles in outdoor road games, with no wins and poor passing performance stats in those environments.
Falcons running back Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game, posing a dual-threat challenge for the Patriots.
The Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed, with standout performances from cornerbacks like A.J. Terrell and Dee Alford.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hit a crucial two-run single to give the Dodgers a 3-0 lead in Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez executed a key defensive play, doubling off a runner, sealing the Dodgers' 3-1 win.
The Dodgers' victory over Toronto forces a decisive Game 7 in the World Series.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff celebrated Halloween by dressing as Wizard of Oz characters and a pirate, distributing candy on the T.
Boston Children's Hospital received a visit from Celtics star Jayson Tatum, surprising young patients for Halloween.
Boston Police reported creative costumes like SpongeBob at community events in East Boston.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Unclaimed $50,000 Powerball ticket purchased in Marlborough, MA expires on November 20, 2025.
The winning ticket, a Quic Pic from New Capital Farms, matches numbers 16-30-60-62-64 with Powerball 25.
Expired prize funds will be redistributed to Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns if not claimed in time.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin married on Halloween at Willows Park in Salem, wearing black-themed wedding attire.
Justice of the Peace Penny Richards officiated the ceremony, which was featured on WBZ radio and television.
The couple from West Virginia enjoyed a week in Salem, marking the proceedings of their spook-themed wedding.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points, leading the Celtics to a narrow 109-108 victory over the 76ers.
The Celtics improved to a .500 record and 1-0 in NBA Cup’s Group B play with the win.
Hugo González contributed five rebounds and five fouls, displaying notable defensive effort despite his inexperience.
